channel.title: Finally got an LCD moniter but
channel.description: Well I finally got an LCD monitor, but it seems that dark colors seem to have some kind of weird static effect to it. Is this normal for LCD screens?

item.title: Finally got an LCD moniter but
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Mopman:

Be sure its not just your eyes. Not saying it is, but when I first switched to LCD (only a year and a bit ago, I was a diehard CRT fanboy) for a few weeks I kept seeing all sorts of horrible weird shit on the screen. Got used to it though (though I still prefer CRT :/)

I thought I was the only one

Read full topic
item.source: Finally got an LCD moniter but

item.title: Finally got an LCD moniter but
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Mopman:

Be sure its not just your eyes. Not saying it is, but when I first switched to LCD (only a year and a bit ago, I was a diehard CRT fanboy) for a few weeks I kept seeing all sorts of horrible weird shit on the screen. Got used to it though (though I still prefer CRT :/)

I actually can’t look at anything other then LCD. When I do, my eyes hurt like hell, probably due to terrible refresh rates on the school computers (that’s the only place without LCD).

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:

[quote=“T4_, post:20, topic:282786”][quote author=jme link=topic=373685.msg2819776#msg2819776 date=1244510871]

Then I showed my parents it, and their like I can’t see anything. Then their like all pixels do that. And they still say they can’t see anything. So how do all “pixels…” do that if they don’t see anything…

Don’t go to parents for computer advice
[/quote]
Unless they’re computer scientists/engineers.[/quote]
my dad works with cmputers for a living, doesnt know shit

item.source: Finally got an LCD moniter but

item.title: Finally got an LCD moniter but
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

bjc22:

It says LCD in the title. But my mom said plasma.

wtf does she know.
Probably saw a commercial for a plama TV once, and now assumes that every screen less than 10 inches in depth is a plasma.

19" Widescreen Active Matrix TFT LCD Display
TFT LCD != Plasma.

Read full topic

item.source: Finally got an LCD moniter but

item.title: Finally got an LCD moniter but
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“bjc22, post:13, topic:282786”]Acer is the same company as Emachine, so I don’t see how that’s possible.

And the monitor wouldn’t turn on for 20 minutes, but after that it was working fine again. Maybe that’s because I always left the monitor on, but it was off. Like it shows the blue light when its in use and the orange one when its not.

Also it’s an HD monitor, I dunno if that makes a difference.

The static effect is only noticable if your like 2 feet in front of the monitor and you have to be viewing solid dark gray colors. Anything other than that you can’t see it in.

I talked to my mother today and she said it was normal because it was a plasma screen. But I have no idea.[/quote]
so is it plasma or lcd…

Read full topic
item.source: Finally got an LCD moniter but

item.title: Finally got an LCD moniter but
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Acer is the same company as Emachine, so I don’t see how that’s possible.

And the monitor wouldn’t turn on for 20 minutes, but after that it was working fine again. Maybe that’s because I always left the monitor on, but it was off. Like it shows the blue light when its in use and the orange one when its not.

Also it’s an HD monitor, I dunno if that makes a difference.

The static effect is only noticable if your like 2 feet in front of the monitor and you have to be viewing solid dark gray colors. Anything other than that you can’t see it in.

I talked to my mother today and she said it was normal because it was a plasma screen. But I have no idea.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Yeah, I am using an Acer AL2016W and an x203w right now, good monitors.[/quote]
Surprisingly lightweight too.

item.source: Finally got an LCD moniter but

item.title: Finally got an LCD moniter but
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I personally have a 17" Emachines LCD Screen for over 3 years and it works good. Only defects is that there’s one dead pixel and on dark images you can notice a slight burn in the centre however during normal use both of these problems are not noticeable.

Enjoy saving electricity, old CRT monitors swallow energy in huge lumps.

Read full topic
item.source: Finally got an LCD moniter but

item.title: Finally got an LCD moniter but
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:7, topic:282786”][quote author=bjc22 link=topic=373685.msg2818640#msg2818640 date=1244432189]
I would but I wouldn’t know what I’d be googling.

Also, I just unplugged the monitor and plugged it back in, and it wouldn’t turn on. Then I left it off for 20 mins then it finally turned on.

WTF.
[/quote]

Try what lawl suggested and then take it back to the store. Sounds like a defect if it’s not even turning on. I also don’t recommend staples… At least where I live (Canada) they are very over-priced.[/quote]
Not true for around me, they’re actually really cheap compared to most places.

On-Topic: What lawl said.

Read full topic
